attributes.action: return passenger trains and stations to the six miles of existing, double track rail lines between Kings Norton, Moseley and Moor Street Station in Birmingham city centre in the West Midlands.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: A new, short, curving, linking line called the Bordesley Chord - connecting the Camp Hill line and the Moor Street line - would need to be constructed to send the trains in and out of Moor St Station in Birmingham city centre.  This line could relieve our conurbation's over-loaded roads and is a further 6 out of our 38 miles of empty double track railway lines!

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "return passenger trains and stations to the six miles of existing, double track rail lines between Kings Norton, Moseley and Moor Street Station in Birmingham city centre in the West Midlands."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22259


Prime Minister's Office
